lead_paragraph: A police post on the main road into Tirin Kot in southern Afghanistan was under assault, and an airstrike hit the post instead of the attackers, an official said.

byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Kabul, and Rod Nordland from London.
byline.original: By FAHIM ABED and TAIMOOR SHAH

headline.print_headline: Afghans Say 7 Officers  Died in Errant U.S. Strike
headline.main: At Least 7 Afghan Police Officers Killed in Errant U.S. Strike, Officials Say

snippet: A police post on the main road into Tirin Kot in southern Afghanistan was under assault, and an airstrike hit the post instead of the attackers, an official said....
abstract: Seven Afghan police officers are killed in misdirected American airstrike in Trin Kot, area of Afghanistan in which Taliban insurgents have gained control of more than 38 police posts.
